replies.msg: My Japanese friend Keita has broken up with his girlfriend lately so he’s been really down. To those of you who have broken up and haven’t yet found new love: Keep your chin up ! You might find it worth your while to read “me are from Mars women are from Venus” written by John Gray. He’s a relationship expert whose work elaborates the keys 🔑 to a successful long term relationship. I was reluctant to read it at first since I’m not an avid reader but it turns out to be worth my hike as I’ve learnt loads about how men and women think differently. Many successful couples say that this book is worth its weight in gold. For what it’s worth, you can also find a social worker. Keita will be giving a party next Sunday but alas I couldn’t come because I got work to do. He has opened a sports retailer. He’s got thirty seven million five hundred nine thousand won’s worth of gym and boxing equipment in his store 🏬 Over one million teen hundred sixteen thousand won’s worth of machines, boxing rings and punching bags have been shipped worldwide in the past ten months so he’s doing a fantastic job. He loves gambling 🎰 in fact he’s on his way to a casino where he’ll up the ante on the poker machines this time which he’s excited about 🤣He did four hour’s worth of work this morning before heading for the casino though. Both he and I are boxing 🥊 fan. The promoter has announced that a rematch between Floyd and Manny is being arranged. The fans are very excited about it but Floyd has recently upped the ante by demanding a salary twice as much. Hopefully it’ll eventually happen. Besides gambling and boxing, Keita also loves painting 🖼 but alas he has no talent as a painter 👨🏻‍🎨 I’m planning on retrofitting my boxing gym with a ring. It’s worth having. A retrofit for my personal gym room is necessary too which involves putting in a lat pulldown machine. The book “martial arts styles and technique” is worth reading because it teaches you the correct and effective ways of landing punches and kicks.

啱啱睇到條治愈片

黑狗又亂鳩咁捉條女，之後俾人救返，出埋槍
我唔知可以講咩好

Sooooooo, the Airport turned out kinda crazy for me tonight. Had been live tweeting the discovery of the Chinese cop since it first happened.
After about an hour of him being quizzed, they tried to move him. It seemed that they would exit him via a human passageway. I was right at the front of the passageway ready to film it. It quickly became apparent that it wasn’t a passage way out but a gauntlet for a mass beating. The guy was already beaten up. Now the crowd began to punch and kick him.
Other media looked on and filmed. But I’m just not this kind of person, and I had to protect him, with my own body for nearly 40 mins.
Pretty intense.
Now...
I support escalation. I vividly understand how angry Hong Kongers are. I know I shouldn’t get actively involved. I also know that he was a Chinese cop, dressed as a protester, caught with sticks, and so had evil intentions towards HK.
But on a human level I could not stand by, or even walk away from a man being beaten to a pulp.
So yeah it was a rough ride.
The angry protesters respected what I was doing, and never intentionally hit me, not once. But, I got a few accidental knocks.
-
I’m sorry this happened.
I dunno what the outcome should’ve been. I don’t even know if my protecting him with my own body was the right thing to do.
-
This isn’t a war. It’s a revolution, we’re fighting a system, not individuals.
I think many protesters acted really badly tonight.
But, I also blame the HK police too. Their actions on Sunday, when they dressed up as protesters and then started beating and arresting people changed everything. Everyone is on a hair trigger now and riddled with paranoia and anger.
I said on Sunday, after this despicable tactic, any cop or agent provocateur caught by the protesters would be in life threatening danger. Well, I was proven right tonight, and also got a proxy beating for it. 🤣
Anyway, I’m all fine. A few scratches and bruises over my body and face.
HK is very much broken. Only the government can stop this.
In the meantime, get out and protest whenever you can. Every little will help in the long run.
